events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred at an intersection, resulting in moderate vehicle damage and the start of the claim process.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident following the keywords identified in the incident report submitted by the claimant.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to guide the customer through the process and provide assistance with necessary documentation.
The insurance company officially acknowledged the receipt of the auto accident claim and assured the customer of timely processing.
The customer was requested to submit photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and a copy of the driver’s license to support the claim.
All requested documents including photos, police report, and license copy were submitted by the claimant promptly for claim evaluation.
The claim investigation began with the assigned agent coordinating with accident reconstruction experts and reviewing submitted materials.
The full investigation concluded, confirming the accident circumstances and validating the claimant's version of events without discrepancies.
A settlement offer was proposed based on the estimated repair costs and policy coverage with a clear breakdown sent to the claimant.
The claimant responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the transparent communication throughout the process.
The claim was approved by the insurance company, confirming all terms and finalizing the next steps for payment processing.
The settlement payment was issued to the claimant’s bank account to cover the vehicle repairs as per the approved claim terms.
The auto accident claim was formally closed following the successful disbursement of payment and confirmation from the claimant.
All records and documentation related to the claim were archived securely in the insurance system for future reference.
